BR_text.BRsummary: Error when use "Step Down (arbitrary steps)" in learning rate policy
BR_text.BRdescription:
When I use "Step Down" (arbitrary steps) policy in the learinng rate,  set to "6,50", the digits generated error:
 ValueError: could not convert string to float: ,

comments_0.comment_text:
Which version of DIGITS are you using? This was fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/pull/534>#534</denchmark-link>
 .
 <denchmark-code>$ ./digits-devserver --version
 3.2-dev
 
 $ git describe
 v3.1.0-12-ga95b89e
 </denchmark-code>

comments_2.comment_text: Oh, you used a comma. Use a period.

comments_3.comment_text:
Can I input two step values? Means step down at 6%, and then step down again at 50%.
 I tried "6.50" it does not work.

comments_4.comment_text: Aha, now I see what you're saying! Sorry, I should have read your OP more carefully. That does look like a bug. Hang on a minute ...

comments_5.comment_text:
Wow you found a bug that was present in the initial commit for this repository. Apparently nobody has ever used this feature before - hah!
 Thanks for the bug report. Fix is at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/pull/549>#549</denchmark-link>
  - I'll merge when the TravisCI build passes.

comments_6.comment_text: If it's any comfort, it has never worked for Torch either :-)
